body: Hey @krisselden :smile: Perhaps @Rich-Harris knows what you're talking about here, but I admit to being a bit lost. Do you have a reproducible example I can work with?
@eventualbuddha I'll try to make a simpler example but things seem to get messed up by the naming deconflict (which should also create name entries in the source map).

@eventualbuddha ok, here is the simple example this was created with `rollup index.js -m inline -o bundle.js`

http://goo.gl/DlRN9E

I also checked in that example, with reproduction steps and what to look for.

https://github.com/krisselden/test_rollup_sourcemap

It is somewhere in this code https://github.com/rollup/rollup/blob/master/src/Statement.js#L286
Even if the mappings for the replaced name get fixed, it really should be adding the name to the names section of the source map

rename.from: Magic string usage damages identifier mappings
rename.to: replaceIdentifiers damages source map mappings for deconflicted identifiers

issue.title: Replaced content mapped incorrectly
issue.body: See https://github.com/rollup/rollup/issues/101. The issue is that if you overwrite anything, the character locations are mapped to -1, which [gets interpreted as 0, 0](https://github.com/Rich-Harris/magic-string/blob/master/src/MagicString/encodeMappings.js#L38-L39), completely incorrectly.

body: Thanks for flagging this up @krisselden, it's the kick in the arse I needed to fix this issue upstream. I've just released magic-string 0.7.0 with the relevant changes. Thanks also for the test case, it's very helpful

issue.title: Populate sourcemap `names` array and map names correctly
